name: Hilton Garden Inn Austin Downtown/Convention Center

reviews.text: Cons:
reviews.title: Convenient and Fun Hilton Garden Inn - Downtown Austin

reviews.text: Maid Service was slow when I asked for extra towels after coming from the whirlpool. Parking rates are ridiculous. Street parking is your best bet. Hot water ran out. Water pressure was low at certain times. Iron did not work properly.
reviews.title: Superior Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: The complimentary chocolate chip cookies and lemonade in the lobby. To smell and see that after I first checked in was such a great first impression of the hotel. The whirlpool was amazing. The pool area is great. Location is great - very close to downtown. The room had both a mini fridge and a microwave. The atrium was clean, well-kept, and inviting. Despite the Cons, I would stay at the hotel again so long as they fix those issues I had.
reviews.title: Good location, Good stay

likes.disliked: — the cold shower and the price of the valet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a guest at the Hilton Garden Inn in Austin for 4 days in January. After arriving home from my stay, I realized I had left a cherished item in my room in my rush to check-out.
reviews.title: Quick, convenient stay

likes.disliked: — Creepy bathroom, lumpy bed, small TV

reviews.text: The staff worked hard to find my item and return it to me.
reviews.title: Stay elsewhere til they deal with their problems

reviews.text: I chose the Hilton Garden Inn because it was drastically cheaper than the Hilton down the road. Once I arrived I was thrilled with my choice. The room was clean, the hotel was clean. The gym was nice and open 24 hours a day (big plus when your in conferences all day!). The pool was not swimmable, only for wading/sitting. The hotel restaurant was tasty, if sparsely attended. The business center was great, free printing, if a little slow on the Internet.
reviews.title: Great hotel for business/some leisure travel

reviews.text: The first half of my stay was during the week and I felt like I was one of a handful of people staying there. By Friday there were three weddings and two conferences, plus college football. I still was able to access the gym, and the business center.
reviews.title: Hotel was great - excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a single woman traveler, I asked about safety and the men and women working the desk were very helpful about which streets to take, what to avoid, and hours that I should maybe take a cab. The hotel is right next to the highway, which is where the neighborhood gets a little sketchy. Alone at night, I was relieved to see policemen patrolling and I always felt safe. However, I also didn't stay out late or go out during the earlier portion of the week. That is my only reservation with the hotel. If I had brought my husband or had others staying with me (the rest stayed at the Hilton), I would not have worried about that at all.
reviews.title: Great location, nice hotel

reviews.text: The hotel staff went out of their way to make me feel comfortable.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay - amazing staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had no problems with noise. I was on the 10th floor, facing the highway. There were earplugs and a cute little "Austin's Music carries" note. I never needed them.
reviews.title: Great Birthday Stay in Downtown Austin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nicely located hotel offering easy access to everything Austin has to offer. Be aware that even on the 12th floor, where our room was located, you will still experience road and club noise.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: We usually stay at this hotel when we are visiting family in Austin. I think that the hotel is busy all of the time because the staff seems that they are just going through the motions. The rooms are comfortable and affordable.
reviews.title: Great location in Austin

reviews.text: I'm a Hilton Honors member and frequent traveler, and most of the time I'm 100% pleased with my accomodations whether they are Hilton or Hampton. However, this property is just ....okay. Good things - my room had a gorgeous view of the city, staff was friendly, convienence to the conference center, price. Not as good - a mustly smell in the hotel (perhaps from the Crowne Plaza years?), guest services didn't have a clue about surrounding restaurants and walking distance, and noise (it's right next to the highway). The hotel probably wouldn't be the first place I would go back to for a personal trip, but I wouldn't hestitate to stay if another conference were held here.
reviews.title: Average at Best

reviews.text: Stayed here for SxSW 2009. The Convention Center is just a few minutes walk away - as is the nightlife on 6th Street. My room on the 11th floor looked inward to the Atrium - which meant there wasn't much natural light when I stayed because of bad weather outside. The Kingsize bed was really comfortable, free wifi fast, and the staff were friendly. I thought the restaurant on the top floor had a great view, but was over priced considering great alternatives on 6th Street (like the Boiling Pot or Iron Cactus). There's indoor parking (which I didn't use) but beware of extreme bird poop if you park in the evenings on the streets outside. That may be a seasonal problem. But overall - great value and VERY convenient for SXSW. You can find lower rates from hotels on the other side of the freeway but don't forget to calculate cab fares too and from downtown. It is not walking distance - this hotel most definitely is.
reviews.title: Downtown on 6th is just a few steps away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed here on a Friday and Saturday night while visiting family in Austin. We chose the hotel for its location on 6th street and would highly recommend it as a place to stay if you're interested in going out for drinks, dinner or other entertainment in Austin and don't want to drive. We didn't have any of the problems with noise or lack of hot water that other people have mentioned and we were very satisfied with the staff, facilities and room. Breakfast was not included but I felt that the buffet was good value. The parking is $25/day though, which I think is a rip off.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, no problems, good value

reviews.text: hotel parking rate of 25 bucks a night is a scam- cant even sit out by the pool and talk after eleven no other outside patio for folks to sit around. housekeeping terrible hotel was unclean , messes in elevator dirty underwear back of lobby told desk help numerous times, finally a housekeeper came , and this is the crazy truth- kicked the underwear under the closest rug. gods honest truth.
reviews.title: a lot of hype- housekeeping is very bad,look elsewhere

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a couple of days for a conference.
reviews.title: Nice amenities, but noisy, noisy!!

reviews.text: I got the internet rate of $99/night. Amenity-wise, it's a good deal. Mid-range room with nice sheets, comfortable bed, marble counter bathroom, etc. Another nicety is the free broadband access.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC hotel in a fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I tried the breakfast buffet. It was OK, nothing special. It had local favorites including biscuits & gravy, which was good.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel but service and amenities need work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The problem is the noise. As others have stated:
reviews.title: This hotel totally sucks!

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Austin Downtown Hotel Austin
description: One of the best Austin hotels, offering first-class hospitality in the "Live Music Capitol of the World." We are steps from the business district, the legendary 6th Street and the Warehouse District.
